KannaujAjay Mishra Teni – KheriVijay Kumar Dubey – Kushi NagarSmt. Neelam Sonkar – LalganjRajnath Singh – LucknowPankaj Choudhary – MaharajganjSmt. Hema Malini – MathuraAshok Kumar Rawat – MisrikhKaushal Kishore – MohanlalganjDr. Sanjiv Kumar Baliyan – MuzaffarnagarOm Kumar – NaginaSangam Lal Gupta – PratapgarhGhanshyam Lodhi – RampurRavindra Kushwaha – SalempurParmeshwar Lal Saini – SambhalPraveen Kumar Nishad – Sant Kabir NagarArjun Kumar Sagar – ShahjahanpurSaket Mishra – ShrawastiRajesh Verma – SitapurSakshi Maharaj – UnnaoNarendra Modi (Prime Minister) – VaranasiCongressRam Nath Sikarwar – AmrohaAjay Rai – VaranasiAkhilesh Pratap Singh – BarabankiSadan Prasad – DeoriaAlok Mishra – Fatehpur SikriTanuj Punia – JhansiPradeep Jain Aditya – KanpurDanish Ali – SaharanpurBahujan Samaj Party (BSP)Majid Ali – SaharanpurShripal Singh – KairanaDara Singh Prajapati – MuzaffarnagarVijendra Singh – BijnorSurendra Pal Singh – Nagina (SC)Mohammad Irfan Saidi – MoradabadZeeshan Khan – RampurShaukat Ali – SambhalAmroha – Mujahid HussainDevrit Tyagi – MeerutPraveen Bansal – BaghpatRajendra Singh Solanki – Gautam Buddha NagarGirish Chandra Jatav – Bulandshahr (SC)Abid Ali – AmlaAnees Ahmed Khan, alias Phoolbabu – PilibhitDodram Verma – Shahjahanpur (SC)Phase 1 - BJP won six out of eight seats - BSP secured two seats (Bijnore and Saharanpur). - RLD chief Ajit Singh lost in Muzaffarnagar, and his son Jayant Chaudhury lost in Baghpat.Phase 2 - BJP won six out of eight seats. - BSP won two seats (Saharanpur and Amroha).Phase 3 - BJP emerged victorious in six out of ten seats in western Uttar Pradesh and Rohailkhand. - SP won four parliamentary constituencies (Moradabad, Rampur, Sambhal, and Mainpuri). - Mulayam Singh Yadav's daughter-in-law is presently an MP from Mainpuri.Phase 4 - BJP won all 13 seats from the Awadh and Bundelkhand regions. - SP supremo Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav lost to BJP's Subrat Pathak.Phase 5 - BJP won 13 out of 14 seats. - Congress secured one seat (Raebareli) but faced a setback as Rahul Gandhi lost in Amethi to BJP's Smriti Irani.Phase 6 - BJP won nine out of 14 seats in the Purvanchal region. - BSP secured four seats. - Samajwadi Party won one seat (Azamgarh, won by Akhilesh Yadav).Phase 7 - BJP won nine seats (including Prime Minister Narendra Modi retaining Varanasi by a record margin). - BJP ally Apna Dal (S) secured two seats (Mirzapur and Robertsganj). - BSP secured two seats.
Article Summary:
- RLD chief Ajit Singh lost in Muzaffarnagar, and his son Jayant Chaudhury lost in Baghpat.Phase 2 - BJP won six out of eight seats.
- BSP won two seats (Saharanpur and Amroha).Phase 3 - BJP emerged victorious in six out of ten seats in western Uttar Pradesh and Rohailkhand.
- Mulayam Singh Yadav's daughter-in-law is presently an MP from Mainpuri.Phase 4 - BJP won all 13 seats from the Awadh and Bundelkhand regions.
- SP supremo Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav lost to BJP's Subrat Pathak.Phase 5 - BJP won 13 out of 14 seats.
- Samajwadi Party won one seat (Azamgarh, won by Akhilesh Yadav).Phase 7 - BJP won nine seats (including Prime Minister Narendra Modi retaining Varanasi by a record margin).

Article Title: Happy Telugu New Year 2024: Ugadi Wishes, Messages, Quotes, Images, Facebook & Whatsapp status

adi

Messages for Ugadi 2024

Ugadi marks the beginning of a new year according to the Hindu lunisolar calendar, typically falling in March or April. Derived from the Sanskrit wordsmeaning age andmeaning beginning, Ugadi signifies the start of a new era, symbolising renewal, rejuvenation, and the triumph of good over evil. It is a time for reflection, gratitude, and the shedding of the old to embrace the new.The festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and fervour in various parts of India, especially in the states of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Maharashtra.On this auspicious day, people wake up before dawn, take a ritualistic bath, and decorate their homes with mango leaves and colourful rangoli designs. Special prayers and rituals are performed to invoke blessings from the divine for prosperity, success, and happiness in the coming year. Ugadi is also marked by the consumption of a special mixture called, which symbolises the various flavours of life - sweet, sour, bitter, salty, and spicy - reminding people to embrace the ups and downs with equanimity. Overall, Ugadi is a celebration of new beginnings, cherished traditions, and the eternal cycle of life.See more: Happy Telugu New Year 2024: Ugadi Wishes, Messages, Quotes, Images, Facebook & Whatsapp status As we usher in this festive day, let us extend our heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to spread happiness and positivity all around.Here are some creative wishes for Ugadi 2024 you can send to your family and friends.Wishing you and your family a Happy Ugadi! May this new year bring you prosperity, success, and boundless joy.On this auspicious occasion of Ugadi, may you be blessed with good health, happiness, and prosperity. Wishing you a year filled with love and laughter.May the divine blessings of Lord Brahma shower upon you and your loved ones on this Ugadi. Wishing you a blessed and prosperous year ahead.Let this Ugadi be a harbinger of new beginnings and a brighter tomorrow. May your path be illuminated with positivity and hope. Here's wishing you a year filled with growth and fulfilment.May the festival of Ugadi fill your life with positivity, peace, and prosperity. Ugadi, also known as Yugadi, is a significant festival celebrated in the states of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, and Maharashtra, marking the beginning of a new lunar year. It is observed with much fervour and enthusiasm, as it symbolises new beginnings, prosperity, and joy.Just like every faith has a number of festivals which they observe in their unique way, Ugadi is a cherished Hindu festival that holds a significant place among the diverse festivities of the nation.Predominantly celebrated in Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and parts of Maharashtra, Ugadi signifies the commencement of the Hindu lunisolar calendar's new year, typically falling in March or April. It symbolises the advent of spring and the harvest season, representing fresh starts, abundance, and happiness.The term ‘Ugadi’ originates from Sanskrit words ‘Yuga,’ denoting age, while ‘Adi,’ means beginning, symbolising the dawn of a new era. On this auspicious day, people rise before dawn, perform a ceremonial oil bath, and don new attire. They offer prayers at temples, seeking blessings for the year ahead.\See more: Happy Ugadi 2024: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes to share with your loved ones Ugadi celebrations feature the preparation and consumption of special delicacies, with each region having their own special delicacies. Article Title: How will the Total Solar Eclipse impact Ramadan this year
Article Text:
Ramadan is a period of fasting which occurs on the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar. Source: iStock

A glimpse into fraser town during Ramadan

The intersection of celestial events with religious observances has always been a subject of fascination and significance. This year, the occurrence of a total solar eclipse during the holy month of Ramadan presents a unique convergence of astronomy and spirituality. The eclipse, which is set to take place on April 8, 2024, has prompted discussions and considerations regarding its impact on the observation of Ramadan, particularly in relation to the sighting of the moon, which plays a crucial role in Islamic traditions.Ramadan, occurring in the ninth month of the Islamic lunar calendar , is universally observed by Muslims as a period of fasting, prayer, introspection, and communal bonding..The beginning and end of Ramadan are traditionally determined by the sighting of the crescent moon also known as the Shawwal moon. The sighting of the Shawwal moon is a significant event that marks the end of Ramadan and the beginning of Eid al-Fitr . In 2024, the astronomical new moon (conjunction) is on April 8, at 18:21 Universal Time. On this day, the moon will not be visible anywhere in the world. However, on April 9, it is expected to be easily seen in Europe, Africa, and the Americas. By April 10, the moon should be visible worldwideHowever, the total solar eclipse this year coincides with the end of Ramadan, potentially affecting the visibility of the moon and the determination of Eid al-Fitr, the festival that marks the end of the fasting period.A total solar eclipse occurs when the moon passes between the Earth and the Sun, completely blocking the sun’s light. This event is the only time when the new moon, which is typically obscured by the sun’s glare, becomes visible as a silhouette against the sun. The eclipse thus provides a rare opportunity to observe the new moon directly, albeit briefly and only within the path of totality.The timing of the eclipse could influence the traditional moon sighting practices. Since the new moon signifies the end of a lunar month, the eclipse could lead to an earlier confirmation of the new moon’s presence. However, experts suggest that it is unlikely to see the lunar crescent just hours after a new moon, which means that the sighting of the crescent moon necessary to mark the end of Ramadan and the beginning of Eid al-Fitr may not be possible immediately following the eclipse.The solar eclipse’s impact on Ramadan is not just astronomical but also cultural. In regions where the eclipse will be visible, local religious authorities may issue special guidelines for moon sighting. These guidelines will take into account the astronomical data and the traditional methods of moon sighting to determine the most appropriate time for declaring the end of Ramadan.The eclipse occurring on April 8 may affect the visibility of the crescent moon, but with the moon expected to be visible the following day, the impact on Ramadan and the timing of Eid al-Fitr is anticipated to be minimal.The total solar eclipse of 2024 is set to be a significant event for both astronomers and the Muslim community . While it may pose challenges to traditional moon sighting practices, it also offers an opportunity for increased understanding and dialogue between science and spirituality. As the Muslim world prepares for Ramadan this year, the eclipse will undoubtedly be a topic of interest and reflection.The total solar eclipse on April 8 will affect the Shawwal crescent moon's visibility, delaying the sighting until April 9, the 30th day of Ramadan. Initially, Eid al-Fitr was expected to commence on April 9, but the eclipse alters this prediction. As a result, the crescent moon is anticipated to appear after sunset on April 9, making April 10 likely to mark the start of Shawwal and Eid al-Fitr.
Article Summary:
This year, the occurrence of a total solar eclipse during the holy month of Ramadan presents a unique convergence of astronomy and spirituality.
The sighting of the Shawwal moon is a significant event that marks the end of Ramadan and the beginning of Eid al-Fitr .
In regions where the eclipse will be visible, local religious authorities may issue special guidelines for moon sighting.
As the Muslim world prepares for Ramadan this year, the eclipse will undoubtedly be a topic of interest and reflection.The total solar eclipse on April 8 will affect the Shawwal crescent moon's visibility, delaying the sighting until April 9, the 30th day of Ramadan.
Initially, Eid al-Fitr was expected to commence on April 9, but the eclipse alters this prediction.

Article Title: Brain teaser test: Only people with high IQ will be able to spot 3 animals in 10 seconds
Article Text:
(Image Credits: The Sun)

‘Pick your Battles’: CJI Chandrachud tells probe agencies CBI must focus on crimes that threaten National Security

Truth behind brain teasers and optical illusions

Difference between optical illusions and brain teasers

Brain teasers can keep you challenged and increase cognitive function one improves good problem-solving skills and also plays brain games which help one to discover and hone these essential skills in life. A brain teaser or a puzzle challenges our brain to further discover new solutions to solving the issues by boosting critical thinking skills.Brain games include teasers, riddles, crossword puzzles, and quizzes at times are marketed as easy and effective ways to help our mind expand and increase our intelligence level, but many of us play these games in the hope that they will indeed sharpen our memory power and improve our brain function.However, beware as not all brain games make us smarter.However, you will enjoy the above brain teaser. In this image, you will be able to see a father working in his garage with his two kids, a son, and a daughter. The kids are joyfully helping their father, whereas their dog is cheerfully playing and wiggling his tail. However, you need to have a hawk eye to locate the hidden three animals in the image. Keep your tippy toes fast as the clock is ticking and you only have 10 seconds in hand.These types of brain teasers increase the happiness and satisfaction quotient of our minds. The moment you complete a challenge, you automatically feel a sense of accomplishment and happiness which boosts or motivates your brain to further go and try more such tasks. This cycle will not only improve your cognitive abilities and focus skills, but it will also improve your overall memory power.Returning to the brain teaser if you have already found the answer then congratulations as you have a high IQ with a hawk eye power. However, for those who have not been able to find the answer, do not be discouraged as we have several such engaging articles for you. Now, taking a moment to reveal the answer, you will be able to locate the three animals, camouflaging with the leaves, and one sitting behind the dog. Run your brains and eyes actively for the next task.The first glance sight is a complex process that mainly involves our eyes to send raw information for our brain to further interpret. This visual system therefore takes several short cuts and makes edits to images which we are not even aware of, and thus at times they fool our brains, but improve our cognitive abilities.Optical illusions tend to make us see something that is not even present there or conceal our minds with some object present in the picture. On the other hand, brain teasers challenge us to solve a particular problem or issue using our reasoning and creative abilities. But both mainly challenges us to think out of the box.
Article Summary:
In this image, you will be able to see a father working in his garage with his two kids, a son, and a daughter.
However, you need to have a hawk eye to locate the hidden three animals in the image.
Keep your tippy toes fast as the clock is ticking and you only have 10 seconds in hand.These types of brain teasers increase the happiness and satisfaction quotient of our minds.
Now, taking a moment to reveal the answer, you will be able to locate the three animals, camouflaging with the leaves, and one sitting behind the dog.
On the other hand, brain teasers challenge us to solve a particular problem or issue using our reasoning and creative abilities.

Article Title: Meet Boji, the dog who uses metro, ferry and tram to travel 30 km daily alone
Article Text: Meet Boji, Istanbul's extraordinary street dog who captivates hearts by commuting up to 30 kilometers daily using public transportation. Beloved by residents, Boji's adventures are documented on social media, showcasing his love for travel. Embraced by the city, Boji receives care and attention from municipal workers, symbolizing Istanbul's inclusive spirit. Recently adopted, Boji now enjoys a permanent home while still embarking on occasional city jaunts, embodying the unique bond between a community and its animals.

Article Title: Weight Loss Cinnamon water: How adding Chia seeds to Cinnamon water can melt belly fat?
Article Text:
Why add Chia seeds to soaked cinnamon water?

Why Chia seeds?

Why is cinnamon good for weight loss?

High in Fiber:

Slow Digestion:

Protein and Healthy Fats:

Metabolism Boost:

Blood Sugar Regulation:

Appetite Control:

Good for hydration:

Irritable Bowel Syndrome

Note

Trying hard to lose belly fat and stay in shape? Then read on as we share a simple homemade drink, which can help in melting belly fat faster that too without putting much effort. Well, this simple drink is nothing but a simple lukewarm cinnamon water, but what boosts the efficacy of this drink is the addition of chia seeds. Chia seeds and cinnamon water offer a wealth of health benefits.This dynamic duo aids weight loss , stabilizes blood sugar levels, and promotes heart health. Rich in antioxidants and fiber, they boost digestion and provide sustained energy. Incorporating chia seeds and cinnamon water into your diet supports overall wellness and vitality. This cinnamon water is simply prepared by soaking cinnamon stick to a pitcher of water overnight in the refrigerator. Alternatively, one can bring the water to a boil, add cinnamon powder, and simmer for 10 minutes. Make sure to strain this water before consumption.Chia seeds and cinnamon water make for a potent combination for improving digestive health and boosting metabolic rate, which helps in better absorption of nutrients and fiber in chia seeds helps adding bulk to the stool, which helps in improves gut health. Here's how they may help with losing weight faster, metabolism, appetite control , and blood sugar regulation .Chia seeds are naturally rich in essential nutrients. These tiny seeds are rich in both soluble and insoluble fiber, which helps in better digestion, promotes bowel regularity, helps in colon cleansing and helps regulate blood sugar levels. Chia seeds also contain all nine essential amino acids and are loaded with heart-healthy omega-3 fatty acids, particularly alpha-linolenic acid (ALA), which supportscardiovascular health by reducing inflammation and lowering cholesterol levels.Apart from that, antioxidants such as polyphenols and flavonoids in chia seeds help in combating oxidative stress and inflammation, protecting cells from damage and reducing the risk of chronic diseases. Chia seeds are also rich in minerals like calcium, magnesium, phosphorus, and manganese, which are essential for bone health, muscle function, and overall well-being. Here are some common reasons to add chia seeds to cinnamon water. Despite being small in size, chia seeds are packed with nutrients such as omega-3 fatty acids, calcium, magnesium, and various vitamins. They can help meet your nutritional needs while keeping your calorie intake in check. Chia seeds are a good source of calcium, magnesium, and phosphorus, which are essential minerals for bone health. Consuming adequate amounts of these minerals can help maintain strong and healthy bones, reducing the risk of osteoporosis and fractures. Due to their high fiber and protein content, chia seeds can help promote feelings of fullness and satiety, which may aid in weight management and reducing food cravings.Unlike some other seeds, such as flaxseeds, chia seeds do not need to be ground before consumption to unlock their nutritional benefits. The outer shell of chia seeds is easily digestible.Cinnamon has the ability to regulate blood sugar levels, leading to reduced cravings and appetite. Additionally, it boosts metabolism, aiding in the breakdown of carbohydrates, fats, and proteins. Its antioxidant properties may also support overall health and weight management when combined with a balanced diet and exercise. Chia seeds can absorb water and expand in the stomach, creating a feeling of fullness and delaying the emptying of the stomach, which may help control hunger and calorie intake.Chia seeds are rich in soluble fiber, which absorbs water and forms a gel-like substance in the stomach. This can help increase feelings of fullness and reduce appetite, potentially leading to lower calorie intake.The fiber content in chia seeds slows down the digestion process, which can help stabilize blood sugar levels and prevent spikes in insulin. This may reduce cravings and overeating, promoting weight loss.Chia seeds are also a good source of plant-based protein and healthy fats, which can further contribute to satiety and help regulate appetite.Both chia and cinnamon contains compounds that may help boost metabolism and increase the body's ability to burn fat. This can potentially lead to greater calorie expenditure and weight loss.Both chia seeds and cinnamon has been shown to improve insulin sensitivity and reduce insulin resistance, which can help regulate blood sugar levels. Stable blood sugar levels may reduce cravings for sugary foods and prevent overeating.Drinking cinnamon water with chia seeds may help control appetite by delaying gastric emptying and promoting feelings of fullness. This can lead to reduced calorie intake and support weight loss efforts.When soaked in water or other liquids, chia seeds form a gel-like substance due to their high soluble fiber content. This gel helps retain moisture and may aid in hydration and electrolyte balance.Chia seeds are often considered beneficial for individuals with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) due to their high fiber content and potential to alleviate digestive issues. The soluble fiber in chia seeds can help regulate bowel movements and reduce symptoms of constipation, which is a common concern for IBS sufferers. In fact, the gel-like consistency formed when chia seeds are mixed with liquids can help soothe the digestive tract and ease discomfort associated with IBS. However, it's essential for individuals with IBS to start with small amounts of chia seeds and gradually increase intake to avoid potential exacerbation of symptoms such as bloating or gas.It's important to consume chia seeds in moderation and consider any potential allergies or sensitivities before incorporating them into your diet. Though it is known to help lower blood sugar levels, cinnamon water should be consumed with caution by individuals taking blood-thinning medications, as it may increase the risk of bleeding. Additionally, those allergic to cinnamon or with liver disease should avoid it. As always, it's best to consult with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian for personalized advice on weight loss and nutrition.
Article Summary:
Why add Chia seeds to soaked cinnamon water?
Well, this simple drink is nothing but a simple lukewarm cinnamon water, but what boosts the efficacy of this drink is the addition of chia seeds.
Chia seeds and cinnamon water offer a wealth of health benefits.This dynamic duo aids weight loss , stabilizes blood sugar levels, and promotes heart health.
Incorporating chia seeds and cinnamon water into your diet supports overall wellness and vitality.
This cinnamon water is simply prepared by soaking cinnamon stick to a pitcher of water overnight in the refrigerator.

Article Title: Raj Kapoor would make 'Mera Naam Joker' heroine sit on his lap and narrate scenes, says Ranjeet: 'But he was not being flirtateous'
Article Text: Ranjeet is known for his negative roles in Hindi cinema as he got stereotyped with those! Having said that, Ranjeet is a veteran and his acting prowess can't be denied. In his long career, Ranjeet has made many friends and worked with some of the finest artistes. In a recent interview, Ranjeet also recalled his memories with the late Raj Kapoor who is considered a legend.During a conversation with ANI, Ranjeet said, "Ranjeet added, “When I entered the studio, I saw life-size cut-outs of all the actresses who starred in his (Kapoor’s) films." He further reminisced Kapoor's bond with all his actress with an incident. Recalling a moment on the sets of 'Mera Naam Joker', Ranjeet said, " Mera Naam Joker picture thi na… uski heroine. He told us, ‘Mera Naam Joker ki heroine ko god mein bithakar scene samjhaaya hai (I made them sit on my lap and narrated the scenes). He wasn’t being flirtatious while doing so. He would call the actress ‘putar’ (daughter) when he asked her to sit on his lap"'Mera Naam Joker' is considered one of the most iconic movies of Raj Kapoor. Rishi Kapoor played young Raj Kapoor in the movie and it starred Simi Garewal , Kseniya Ryabinkina, Padmini, Manoj Kumar and Dharmendra.Talking about Raj Kapoor, Ranjeet also recalled his iconic parties. He said there were no inhibitions or formalities. Reena Roy would make parathas, Parveen Babi would make drinks, Moushumi Chattejee would make fish, Neetu Kapoor would make bhindi. It was that kind of atmostphere. Not just actresses had egos but all the heroes would also come together under one roof - from Feroz Khan , Dharmendra to Shatrughan Sinha - 'name a hero and he was there!', said the actor.
Article Summary:
In his long career, Ranjeet has made many friends and worked with some of the finest artistes.
Recalling a moment on the sets of 'Mera Naam Joker', Ranjeet said, " Mera Naam Joker picture thi na… uski heroine.
He told us, ‘Mera Naam Joker ki heroine ko god mein bithakar scene samjhaaya hai (I made them sit on my lap and narrated the scenes).
He would call the actress ‘putar’ (daughter) when he asked her to sit on his lap"'Mera Naam Joker' is considered one of the most iconic movies of Raj Kapoor.
Rishi Kapoor played young Raj Kapoor in the movie and it starred Simi Garewal , Kseniya Ryabinkina, Padmini, Manoj Kumar and Dharmendra.Talking about Raj Kapoor, Ranjeet also recalled his iconic parties.

Article Title: Hair Mehendi Side Effects: Side effects of using Mehendi on your hair
Article Text:
'Oo Antava' star Samantha Ruth Prabhu won't be doing item number in Allu Arjun starrer 'Pushpa: The Rule'

Mehendi, commonly known as henna , has been utilized for centuries as a traditional colourant, natural hair dye and conditioner. Its appeal lies in its ability to impart a rich reddish-brown natural hue to the hair while also providing conditioning benefits. However, like any hair treatment, the use of Mehendi can entail potential side effects, especially if not applied correctly or if certain sensitivities are present.It's crucial to comprehend these potential side effects to make informed decisions about incorporating Mehendi into one's hair care regimen.Allergic reactionsA usually prevalent side effect of applying Mehendi to hair is allergic reactions. While generally considered safe for most individuals, some may exhibit an allergic response to the plant dye. Symptoms of an allergic reaction can include itching, redness, swelling, or a rash on the scalp or skin. In severe cases, an allergic reaction may result in contact dermatitis, causing discomfort and necessitating medical attention. To mitigate the risk of allergic reactions, it's advisable to conduct a patch test before applying Mehendi to the entire scalp and hair.Dryness and brittlenessMehendi possesses drying properties that can often lead to dryness and brittleness in the hair, particularly if used frequently or left on for an extended duration. The dye molecules in Mehendi adhere to the keratin in the hair shaft, potentially stripping away natural oils and moisture. This can result in hair that feels rough, straw-like, and prone to breakage. To counteract dryness and brittleness, it's essential to follow Mehendi treatments with deep conditioning or oil treatments to restore moisture and nourishment to the hair.Colour variabilityAnother possible side effect of Mehendi application on hair is colour variability. The final colour outcome achieved with Mehendi may vary depending on factors such as the quality of the Mehendi powder, the duration of application, and the natural colour of the hair. While Mehendi typically imparts a reddish-brown tint to the hair, the resulting color may appear differently on various hair types and textures. Additionally, repeated applications of Mehendi over time may lead to a buildup of colour, resulting in a darker shade than intended.Scalp irritationSome individuals may experience scalp irritation or discomfort following Mehendi application. This can manifest as itching, burning, or redness on the scalp, causing inconvenience and distress. Scalp irritation may occur due to an allergic reaction to Mehendi or as a result of leaving the dye on for too long. To minimize scalp irritation, it's crucial to adhere to the manufacturer's instructions, avoid prolonged exposure to Mehendi, and ensure thorough rinsing after application.Hair texture changesUsing Mehendi on hair may also result in changes to the hair's texture over time. While Mehendi is praised for its conditioning properties, some individuals may notice their hair becoming coarser or rougher with regular use. This change in texture may be attributed to Mehendi's drying effect on the hair or the accumulation of dye molecules within the hair shaft. To preserve hair texture, it's essential to balance Mehendi treatments with deep conditioning and moisturizing routines.While Mehendi is a popular natural hair dye and conditioner, it's crucial to be mindful of its potential side effects. Allergic reactions, dryness, brittleness, color variability, scalp irritation, and changes in hair texture are among the possible side effects associated with Mehendi application. By understanding these risks and taking appropriate precautions, individuals can enjoy the benefits of Mehendi while minimizing any potential adverse effects. As with any hair treatment, conducting a patch test and following manufacturer instructions diligently can help ensure a safe and satisfactory experience.
Article Summary:
The dye molecules in Mehendi adhere to the keratin in the hair shaft, potentially stripping away natural oils and moisture.
While Mehendi typically imparts a reddish-brown tint to the hair, the resulting color may appear differently on various hair types and textures.
To preserve hair texture, it's essential to balance Mehendi treatments with deep conditioning and moisturizing routines.While Mehendi is a popular natural hair dye and conditioner, it's crucial to be mindful of its potential side effects.
Allergic reactions, dryness, brittleness, color variability, scalp irritation, and changes in hair texture are among the possible side effects associated with Mehendi application.
By understanding these risks and taking appropriate precautions, individuals can enjoy the benefits of Mehendi while minimizing any potential adverse effects.

Article Title: Relief for taxpayers on HRA claims! Income Tax Department clarifies no special drive to reopen mismatch cases
Article Text: HRA claims relief: The Central Board of Direct Taxes ( CBDT ) has clarified that there is no special drive to reopen cases related to House Rent Allowance (HRA) claims. The income tax department stated that there is no ongoing special drive to review mismatch cases. Concerns have emerged about potential retrospective taxation and reopening cases related to HRA claims.However, the Income Tax Department has assured taxpayers that these concerns are unfounded. Instances of information mismatch have been identified, prompting the department to notify taxpayers to rectify any discrepancies. The department emphasized that concerns about retrospective taxation and reopening cases on HRA matters are baseless.“At the outset, it is stated that any apprehensions about retrospective taxation on these matters and re-opening of cases on issues pertaining to HRA claims is completely baseless,” the tax department has said according to an ET report.Also Read | Understanding HRA exemption rules & benefits: Saving tax on rent allowance - know eligibility, calculation, documents required & more Data analysis was conducted in select high-value cases to scrutinize rent payment discrepancies during the fiscal year 2020-21. This process was limited and did not involve a widespread reopening of cases. There were cases of mismatch between rent payment claims by employees and the rent received by landlords.Also Read | New Vs Old Tax Regime: How income of even Rs 10 lakh can be tax-free under old tax regime Taxpayers had time till March 31, 2024, to update returns for the relevant assessment year.The primary aim of the verification exercise was to address information mismatches for the fiscal year 2020-21 without affecting other cases. The income tax department reiterated that there is no large-scale drive to reopen cases, specifically related to HRA claims.House Rent Allowance (HRA) is a key part of salary income, eligible for tax exemptions . Employees in rented accommodations can claim these exemptions by providing valid rent receipts.
Article Summary:
HRA claims relief: The Central Board of Direct Taxes ( CBDT ) has clarified that there is no special drive to reopen cases related to House Rent Allowance (HRA) claims.
The income tax department stated that there is no ongoing special drive to review mismatch cases.
Concerns have emerged about potential retrospective taxation and reopening cases related to HRA claims.However, the Income Tax Department has assured taxpayers that these concerns are unfounded.
Instances of information mismatch have been identified, prompting the department to notify taxpayers to rectify any discrepancies.
The income tax department reiterated that there is no large-scale drive to reopen cases, specifically related to HRA claims.House Rent Allowance (HRA) is a key part of salary income, eligible for tax exemptions .

Article Title: Sukma’s Ram temple reopens 21 yrs after Maoists shut it down
Article Text: RAIPUR: When Prime Minister Narendra Modi was talking about the fulfilment of a 500-year-old dream at Ram Mandir in Ayodhya in a Bastar village on Monday, temple bells were ringing 180km away to celebrate the reopening of a Ram temple in one of the worst Maoist-hit areas of Sukma .Security forces have reopened the temple in Kerlapenda village that was shut 21 years ago on Maoist diktat.This off-the-road hamlet is in the middle of a Maoist stronghold — barely 10km from Tadmetla, the site of the massacre of 76 jawans in 2010, and close to Hidma's stronghold of Tekulguda, where 22 jawans were killed in April 2021.The fear of the Maoists was such that once the insurgents ordered villagers not to visit the temple, no one dared go anywhere near it. All but one. A lone villager would quietly light a lamp outside the closed door every day, keeping the glow alive.On Saturday, scores of locals thronged the temple, guarded by heavily armed CRPF and police personnel, as the doors were opened and sunlight streamed in for the first time in 21 years. The temple was cleaned up and the marble idols of Lord Ram, Mata Sita and Laxman were worshipped.Yet again, what has turned the tide here is a CRPF camp set up a few days ago in between Kerlapenda and Lakhapal villages, around 10km apart within a densely forested region.“In 2003, when Maoists were at their most active, they had ordered villagers to shut the temple and warned that no one should open it or visit for worship. The reason was that this region was the core zone of Maoists, where they would camp, hold meetings, and use it as a corridor for movement,” Sukma SP Kiran Chavan told TOI.After the CRPF camp was opened, tribals who otherwise never interacted with outsiders, came in touch with security personnel.Himanshu Pandey, CRPF commandant of 74 Battalion said, “The new camp was opened on March 11, and during area domination, jawans saw this temple. Locals told them that Maoists had tried to damage the temple in 2003 and forced it shut. Once, villagers would hold religious fairs at the temple. On request of tribals, we initiated the reopening of the temple and helped in cleaning it and organizing puja.”CRPF assistant commandant from Lakhapal security camp, Ravi Kumar Meena, said that the request to reopen the temple came during a medical camp organized by the forces. A medical camp was organized in front of the temple on Monday.Kerlapenda is around 90km from Sukma district headquarters, with the last few miles having to be covered on foot.The district administration is now trying to trace the history of the temple. No one knows how old it is but officials believe it could be a couple of centuries old because it is made of stone. The village of 800 now plans a ‘bhandara’ on Ram Navmi.
Article Summary:
Locals told them that Maoists had tried to damage the temple in 2003 and forced it shut.
Once, villagers would hold religious fairs at the temple.
On request of tribals, we initiated the reopening of the temple and helped in cleaning it and organizing puja.”CRPF assistant commandant from Lakhapal security camp, Ravi Kumar Meena, said that the request to reopen the temple came during a medical camp organized by the forces.
No one knows how old it is but officials believe it could be a couple of centuries old because it is made of stone.
The village of 800 now plans a ‘bhandara’ on Ram Navmi.

Article Text:
Karnataka 2nd PUC Result

Karnataka 2nd PUC past year pass-percentage, number of students appeared and other details

The Karnataka Department of Pre-University Education is expected to declare the 2nd Pre-University Certificate (PUC) result in the 3rd week of April 2024, according to media reports.Once released, candidates who had taken the exam can check the their class 12 results on the official website at karresults.nic.in and kar.nic.in/pue by entering their individual login credentials.The Karnataka 2nd PUC results will be released in two websites- karresults.nic.in and pue.kar.nic.in. Here's a step-by-step guide to download the provisional marksheet online:Go to the official website- karresults.nic.inClick on the link for KSEAB PUC Result 2024 on the homepage.Enter your login credentials.The Karnataka 2nd PUC Result 2024 will be displayed on the screen.View and download the scorecard. Ensure to keep a hard copy for future reference.More than 6.9 lakh students took the KSEAB class 12th exams in 2024, with 3.3 lakh men and 3.6 lakh women. They are currently awaiting the release of the Karnataka 2nd PUC Results 2024. In addition to the results, the board will release pass percentages, toppers lists, and other statistics. Here's a look at the past seven years.In 2023, the Karnataka 2nd PUC examination witnessed a notable performance from female candidates, with a pass percentage of 80.25%, while male candidates achieved a pass percentage of 69.05%. The overall pass percentage stood at 74.67%. A total of 7,26,195 students appeared for the examination, reflecting a steady rise in participation compared to previous years.The results of the Karnataka 2nd PUC exams in 2022 showcased a slight improvement compared to the preceding year. Female students outperformed their male counterparts, securing a pass percentage of 68.72%, while boys achieved a pass percentage of 55.22%. The overall pass percentage rose to 61.88%, with a total of 6,83,563 students appearing for the examination.In the year 2021, all candidates, both girls and boys, achieved a commendable 100% pass rate in the Karnataka 2nd PUC exams. The total number of students who appeared for the examination amounted to 6,66,497, marking a significant milestone in academic achievement.The Karnataka 2nd PUC results for the year 2020 depicted a similar trend as previous years, with female students maintaining a higher pass percentage of 68.73%, compared to 54.73% for male students. The overall pass percentage stood at 61.73%, with a total of 6,75,277 students appearing for the examination.In 2019, 68.2% of girls passed the Karnataka 2nd PUC examination, while 55% of boys did. The overall pass percentage was reported at 67.73%, with 6,88,145 students taking the exam.The results of the Karnataka 2nd PUC exams in 2018 followed a similar pattern, with female students passing at 67.1% and male students at 52.3%. The overall pass percentage was 59.56%, with 6,71,000 students taking the exam.In 2017, female candidates outperformed male candidates in the Karnataka 2nd PUC exams, with a pass rate of 60.28% versus 44.74%. The overall pass rate was 52.38%, with 6,90,000 students taking part in the exam.

Article Title: Lok Sabha polls: MVA announces seat-sharing deal for Maharashtra
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi on Tuesday announced seat-sharing deal in Maharashtra for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections .According to the arrangement, Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena will contest on 21 seats, Congress 17 and Sharad Pawar-led NCP on 10.After weeks of negotiations, Sharad Pawar, the chief of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), Uddhav Thackeray, leader of the Shiv Sena (UBT), and Nana Patole, the president of the state Congress, jointly announced the poll pact for the 48 parliamentary seats in the state during a press conference.The Congress party has given up its claims on the contested Sangli and Bhiwandi seats, paving the way for the Shiv Sena (UBT) and the NCP (SP) to contest in the upcoming elections. The Sena (UBT) emphasized that the primary aim of this alliance is to challenge the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), while the Congress has expressed a willingness to be "large-hearted" in pursuit of this common goal."When victory against the BJP is the larger goal, we have to set aside certain differences," he said when asked about the Shiv Sena (UBT) refusing to give Sangli seat to the Congress."Prime Minister Narendra Modi's speech yesterday was not that of a prime minister. When we respond, please don't take it as an insult of the prime minister. Our criticism will be about a leader of a corrupt party," Thackeray said to a query on Modi referring to his party as "fake Shiv Sena".Meanwhile, Maharashtra Congress president Nana Patole echoed a similar sentiment, emphasizing the party's commitment to the overarching goal of ousting PM Modi and the BJP from power.Patole asserted that Congress workers are resolute in their mission to counter the BJP and secure victories for the MVA candidates in Sangli and Bhiwandi, citing past instances of alleged mistreatment of party leaders by the ruling party.As per the distribution of seats under the alliance agreement, the Shiv Sena (UBT) has secured key constituencies including Jalgaon, Parbhani, Nashik, Palghar, Kalyan, Thane, Raigad, and several others.The Congress, on the other hand, will be contesting from Nandurbar, Dhule, Akola, Amravati, Nagpur, and other significant constituencies.The NCP (SP) will field candidates in constituencies like Baramati, Shirur, Satara, and others.The Lok Sabha elections will be held in the state in five phases from April 19 to May 20.
Article Summary:
NEW DELHI: Opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi on Tuesday announced seat-sharing deal in Maharashtra for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections .According to the arrangement, Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena will contest on 21 seats, Congress 17 and Sharad Pawar-led NCP on 10.After weeks of negotiations, Sharad Pawar, the chief of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), Uddhav Thackeray, leader of the Shiv Sena (UBT), and Nana Patole, the president of the state Congress, jointly announced the poll pact for the 48 parliamentary seats in the state during a press conference.The Congress party has given up its claims on the contested Sangli and Bhiwandi seats, paving the way for the Shiv Sena (UBT) and the NCP (SP) to contest in the upcoming elections.
The Sena (UBT) emphasized that the primary aim of this alliance is to challenge the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), while the Congress has expressed a willingness to be "large-hearted" in pursuit of this common goal.

Article Title: Fake NCERT:NCERT cracks down on unapproved publishers as supply of fake textbooks surge in NCR
Article Text:
CM’s Flying Squad

Cracks Down

NCERT Issues Stern Warning

Risks Associated with Fake Textbooks

Ensuring Access to Authentic Learning Materials

NEW DELHI: The National Capital Region (NCR) is currently grappling with a concerning trend as the demand for NCERT (National Council of Educational Research and Training) books far exceeds the available supply. This shortage has led to a surge in the circulation of counterfeit NCERT textbooks across markets in Gurgaon, Faridabad, and Palwal, raising alarm bells among educators and parents alike.With the onset of the new academic session, schools and students in the NCR region have been eagerly awaiting the availability of NCERT textbooks. However, the empaneled publishers authorized by NCERT have struggled to meet the soaring demand, leaving many classrooms devoid of essential learning materials. This scarcity in the supply chain has created an opportunity for unscrupulous entities to exploit the situation by flooding the market with fake NCERT books .The recent crackdown by the CM’s Flying Squad has unearthed a significant haul of illicitly printed NCERT textbooks in various cities across the NCR. In a series of operations, the squad seized thousands of unauthorized copies, with raids conducted in Faridabad, Palwal, and Gurgaon’s bustling Sadar Bazar. The magnitude of the seizures underscores the severity of the issue and highlights the widespread proliferation of counterfeit educational materials.In response to the escalating crisis, NCERT has issued a stern warning to those involved in the production and distribution of pirated textbooks. Emphasizing the gravity of the situation, NCERT officials have cautioned against the dissemination of factually incorrect content present in these unauthorized publications. The proliferation of counterfeit textbooks not only compromises the quality of education but also undermines the foundational principles of the National Curriculum Framework.The influx of counterfeit NCERT books poses multifaceted risks to students and the education ecosystem at large. Beyond the obvious concerns regarding the accuracy and reliability of the content, there are also legal and ethical implications associated with the unauthorized reproduction and sale of copyrighted educational materials. NCERT has underscored the importance of adhering to copyright laws and has urged the public to refrain from engaging with pirated textbooks.Amidst the crackdown on counterfeit textbooks, efforts are underway to ensure that students have access to authentic and reliable learning materials. NCERT has announced plans to expedite the release of pending textbooks for Class 3 and Class 6, aiming to alleviate the strain on students and educators grappling with the shortage of NCERT books. Additionally, measures are being implemented to streamline the distribution process and enhance accessibility to genuine NCERT textbooks across the NCR.
Article Summary:
This shortage has led to a surge in the circulation of counterfeit NCERT textbooks across markets in Gurgaon, Faridabad, and Palwal, raising alarm bells among educators and parents alike.With the onset of the new academic session, schools and students in the NCR region have been eagerly awaiting the availability of NCERT textbooks.
However, the empaneled publishers authorized by NCERT have struggled to meet the soaring demand, leaving many classrooms devoid of essential learning materials.
This scarcity in the supply chain has created an opportunity for unscrupulous entities to exploit the situation by flooding the market with fake NCERT books .The recent crackdown by the CM’s Flying Squad has unearthed a significant haul of illicitly printed NCERT textbooks in various cities across the NCR.
NCERT has announced plans to expedite the release of pending textbooks for Class 3 and Class 6, aiming to alleviate the strain on students and educators grappling with the shortage of NCERT books.
Additionally, measures are being implemented to streamline the distribution process and enhance accessibility to genuine NCERT textbooks across the NCR.

Article Title: Lok Sabha Election schedule 2024: Dates, full schedule, all you need to know
Article Text:
Lok Sabha schedule

in detail

(With inputs from agencies)

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission of India on Saturday announced the schedule for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.The general polls will be held in 7 phases.First phase to be held on April 19, second on April 26, third phase on May 7, fourth phase on May 13, fifth phase on May 20, sixth phase on May 25 and the seventh phase on June 1, said Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar.A total of 22 states will have single-phase voting, including Delhi. Elections in Maharashtra as well as Jammu and Kashmir will be held in 5 phases, while Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and West Bengal will vote in all 7 phases.Karnataka, Rajasthan, Tripura and Manipur will vote in 2 phases. Chhattisgarh and Assam will see elections in 3 phases, while Odisha, Madhya Pradesh and Jharkhand will witness 4-phase polling.Delhi will be going to the polls on May 25.Phase 1 will be the largest voting bloc. Voting will be done in 21 states/UTs across 102 constituencies on April 19.Elections in Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Sikkim, Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand, Andaman and Nicobar islands, Lakshadweep and Puducherry will start and end on April 19.Phase 2 will see 89 Lok Sabha seats go to the polls across 13 states/UTs. Election to all 20 seats in Kerala will be held during the second phase on April 26.A total of 94 Lok Sabha seats across 12 states/UTs will go to the polls in Phase 3 on May 7. All 26 seats in Gujarat will go to the polls on May 7.Phase 4 will see 96 seats go to the polls in 10 states/UTs. Voters in all 25 seats in Andhra Pradesh and all 17 seats in Telangana will go to the booths on May 13.A total of 49 parliamentary constituencies in 8 states/UTs will vote in the 5th phase on May 20. Lone seat in Ladakh will vote in this phase.Phase 6 will see 57 seats across 7 states/UTs take part in the Lok Sabha elections. All 7 seats in Delhi and 10 seats in Haryana will vote on May 25.The last phase of elections will see 57 seats across 8 states/UTs go to the booths. All seats in Punjab and Himachal will vote on the last day of elections on June 1.In Detail: Lok Sabha Election Schedule The counting of votes will be done on June 4.Besides the Lok Sabha elections, assembly polls will be held in Sikkim, Odisha, Arunachal Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh.
Article Summary:
Election to all 20 seats in Kerala will be held during the second phase on April 26.A total of 94 Lok Sabha seats across 12 states/UTs will go to the polls in Phase 3 on May 7.
All 26 seats in Gujarat will go to the polls on May 7.Phase 4 will see 96 seats go to the polls in 10 states/UTs.
Lone seat in Ladakh will vote in this phase.Phase 6 will see 57 seats across 7 states/UTs take part in the Lok Sabha elections.
All 7 seats in Delhi and 10 seats in Haryana will vote on May 25.The last phase of elections will see 57 seats across 8 states/UTs go to the booths.
All seats in Punjab and Himachal will vote on the last day of elections on June 1.In Detail: Lok Sabha Election Schedule The counting of votes will be done on June 4.Besides the Lok Sabha elections, assembly polls will be held in Sikkim, Odisha, Arunachal Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh.

The Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 promises to be an exhilarating season filled with intense battles between ten formidable teams . This year’s IPL Schedule kicked off with a thrilling clash between defending champions Chennai Super Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru on March 22, which the hosts CSK won comfortably by six wickets.Fans can expect an exciting schedule of riveting encounters at iconic venues like the MA Chidambaram Stadium, Wankhede Stadium, and M Chinnaswamy Stadium.After the first nine matches of the tournament, the host teams enjoyed the home advantage in the current season, winning all nine encounters at home. This trend is making a reverse now with three teams winnings their matches away from home in the last six matches.After 15 matches, only two teams - Rajasthan Royals and Kolkata Knight Riders - remained unbeaten in the league. Royals are leading the standings with three wins, followed by KKR with two wins in as many games.The tournament’s schedule features a total of 70 league matches, followed by playoffs starting on May 21 in Ahmedabad, leading up to the grand finale on May 26. With a total of 74 matches scheduled to be played, cricket enthusiasts are in for a treat.Also See: IPL 2024 Points Table As the schedule of league phase unfolds, teams will vie for the top four spots to secure coveted positions in the playoffs. The top two teams will directly qualify for the first Qualifier, while the third and fourth-placed teams will battle it out in the Eliminator.The winner of Qualifier 1 will proceed to the summit clash, while the losing team will have another chance in a face-off against the winner of the Eliminator for a spot in the IPL 2024 final.

Article Title: Diljit Dosanjh Wedding News: Diljit Dosanjh is MARRIED to an Indo-American and has a son, claims his friend who makes SHOCKING revelations about his life!
Article Text: Diljit Dosanjh has been grabbing eyeballs for a while due to his huge fan following! The actor-cum-singer was loved in his latest release ' Crew ' alongside Kareena Kapoor Khan , Tabu and Kriti Sanon. Meanwhile, he's gearing up for the release of his film ' Chamkila ' alongside Parineeti Chopra . Days before the release of this Imtiaz Ali film, Diljit's friend has made a shocking revelation about him.An unnamed friend of his has said to Sunday Express Eye, that, "An intensely private person, little is known about his family but friends say his wife is an American-Indian and they have a son, and his parents live in Ludhiana." The article also claimed that his wife and son live in the US.Diljit has always been very protective about his personal life and has never spoken about it. However, he recently had opened up on his relationship with his parents and rough childhood. He was forced to move out of his family village at the age of 11. He had said that his parents sent him to live with his uncle (mama ji) to give him a better standard of living but did not ask if he was okay with the decision. This move led to his broken bond with his parents. He added that he still respects them.Earlier, even Kiara Advani had indirectly hinted that Diljit is married and has a son. During the promotions of 'Good Newwz', Kiara had said that the film was a new experience for her because among the other cast members - Kareena Kapoor Khan, Akshay Kumar and Diljit Dosanjh, she's the only one who does not have a baby in real life. So, it was a learning experience for her.Meanwhile, Diljit is gearing for the release of 'Chamkila' on April 12. The film is based on the life of singer Amar Singh Chamkila.
Article Summary:
Diljit Dosanjh has been grabbing eyeballs for a while due to his huge fan following!
Meanwhile, he's gearing up for the release of his film ' Chamkila ' alongside Parineeti Chopra .
The article also claimed that his wife and son live in the US.Diljit has always been very protective about his personal life and has never spoken about it.
He added that he still respects them.Earlier, even Kiara Advani had indirectly hinted that Diljit is married and has a son.
So, it was a learning experience for her.Meanwhile, Diljit is gearing for the release of 'Chamkila' on April 12.

Article Title: Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024: Images, Quotes, Wishes, Messages, Cards, Greetings, Pictures and GIFs

This year's Chaitra Navratri, a nine-day celebration , begins on April 9. On April 17, there will be festivities in honor of Ram Navami. The first day of the Hindu Luni-Solar calendar is Chaitra Navratri. On this day, devotees worship Maa Durga and her nine incarnations: Maa Shailputri, Maa Brahmacharini, Maa Chandraghanta, Maa Kushmanda, Skanda Mata, Maa Katyayani, Maa Kaalratri, Maa Mahagauri, and Maa Siddhidatri.A nine-day celebration, Chaitra Navratri is a Hindu holiday that ushers in the spring. Devotees observe fasts and make prayers throughout the multi-day festivities. Ram Navami , or Lord Rama's birthday, marks the conclusion of the celebration. Devotees offer prayers to nine distinct avatars of Goddess Durga during the course of the festival's nine days.There are rituals like Ghatasthapana, which invokes the goddess Shakti. Chaitra Navratri is celebrated with many of the same customs and rituals as Shardiya Navratri, which takes place in September or October.Drik Panchang states that the dates of this year's Chaitra Navratri celebrations are April 2–April 11.For both Shardiya and Chaitra Navratri, the Ghatasthapana Puja Vidhi is the same. On Ram Navami, they commemorate Lord Ram's birth and adore him as well. Article Title: Navratri Colours: Here is the list of nine colours of Navratri 2024 and their significance
Article Text:
Day 1 - Pratipada (Grey)

Day 2 - Dwitiya (Orange)

Day 3 - Tritiya (White)

Day 4 - Chaturthi (Red)

Day 5 - Panchami (Royal Blue)

Day 6 - Sashti (Yellow)

Day 7 - Saptami (Green)

Day 8 - Ashtami (Peacock Green)

Day 9 - Navami (Purple)

Amp up your home garden for summer

It's that time of the year again! Navratri is around the corner. Navratri, a vibrant and auspicious Hindu festival, is celebrated with great fervor across India. Navratri, meaning "nine nights" in Sanskrit, is an ancient Hindu festival with roots deeply embedded in mythology and tradition. Its origin can be traced back to the Vedic scriptures, where it was celebrated as a harvest festival to honor the divine feminine energy and invoke blessings for a bountiful harvest.Over time, Navratri evolved into a multifaceted celebration, encompassing religious, cultural, and social significance.One of the most prominent legends associated with Navratri is the story of Goddess Durga's victory over the demon Mahishasura. According to Hindu mythology, Mahishasura, a powerful demon, had unleashed a reign of terror on the earth, threatening the balance of the universe. In response to the prayers of gods and goddesses, Durga, an embodiment of divine feminine power, emerged from the collective energy of various deities and waged a fierce battle against Mahishasura for nine days and nights. On the tenth day, known as Vijayadashami or Dussehra, Durga defeated the demon, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil. Navratri commemorates this epic victory of light over darkness, inspiring devotees to seek strength, courage, and righteousness in their own lives.See more: 75+ Happy Chaitra Navratri Messages, Greetings, Wishes, Mantras and Quotes for 2024 Lasting for nine days, Navratri is dedicated to the worship of the divine feminine in various forms, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil. Each day of Navratri is associated with a specific colour, symbolizing different aspects of life and spirituality. Let's find out what's the significance and symbolism of the nine colours of Navratri, guiding devotees through this sacred journey of celebration and introspection, and why you should follow the colour trend this Navratri.Grey, the colour of the first day of Navratri, represents the beginning, symbolizing the awakening of spirituality and initiation of the divine journey. It signifies purity, peace, and the elimination of negativity, preparing devotees for the days ahead filled with worship and devotion.Orange, the colour of the second day, symbolizes energy and enthusiasm. It represents the strength and determination required to overcome obstacles and challenges in life. Devotees wear orange attire to invoke courage and vitality, embracing the spirit of perseverance and resilience.White, the colour of purity and serenity, is associated with the third day of Navratri. It signifies peace, tranquility, and harmony, guiding devotees towards inner purification and spiritual awakening. Wearing white attire invokes divine blessings and fosters a sense of clarity and positivity.See more: Chaitra Navratri 2024: What do the 9 colours of Navratri signify Red, the colour of passion and power, dominates the fourth day of Navratri. It symbolizes strength, courage, and determination, honoring the fierce aspects of the divine feminine. Devotees adorn themselves in red attire to evoke vitality, vitality, and assertiveness, embracing the energy of the Goddess Durga.See more: Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024: Images, Quotes, Wishes, Messages, Cards, Greetings, Pictures and GIFs Royal blue, the colour of royalty and nobility, graces the fifth day of Navratri. It represents divine grace, wisdom, and enlightenment, guiding devotees towards spiritual growth and higher consciousness. Wearing royal blue attire invokes the blessings of wisdom and divine protection, fostering a sense of inner strength and integrity.Yellow, the colour of brightness and optimism, illuminates the sixth day of Navratri. It symbolizes positivity, prosperity, and abundance, invoking the blessings of Goddess Lakshmi. Devotees dress in yellow attire to attract wealth, success, and happiness into their lives, embracing the spirit of optimism and gratitude.Green, the colour of growth and renewal, adorns the seventh day of Navratri. It symbolizes fertility, prosperity, and rejuvenation, honoring the nurturing aspects of the divine feminine. Wearing green attire invokes the blessings of Goddess Saraswati, fostering creativity, knowledge, and spiritual growth.Peacock green, a shade of green with hints of blue, embellishes the eighth day of Navratri. It symbolizes beauty, grace, and elegance, reflecting the vibrant colours of nature. Devotees wear peacock green attire to celebrate the divine feminine in all her splendor, invoking blessings of prosperity and abundance.Purple, the colour of royalty and spirituality, radiates on the ninth day of Navratri. It symbolizes devotion, transformation, and transcendence, honoring the culmination of the divine journey. Devotees dress in purple attire to seek divine blessings for spiritual upliftment and enlightenment, embracing the divine presence within.Navratri colours hold deep significance and symbolism, guiding devotees on a spiritual journey of self-discovery and devotion. Each color represents different virtues and qualities, invoking divine blessings and fostering inner transformation. As devotees celebrate Navratri, may they immerse themselves in the vibrancy of colours and the richness of tradition, experiencing the divine presence in every moment of worship and celebration.Navratri holds profound significance in Hindu culture, serving as a vibrant celebration of devotion and spirituality. Lasting for nine days, Navratri is dedicated to the worship of the divine feminine in her various forms, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil. This auspicious festival is not only a time for prayer and reflection but also a period of profound introspection and renewal. Through rituals, fasting, and prayers, devotees seek to purify their minds and bodies, inviting divine blessings and guidance into their lives. Navratri serves as a reminder of the eternal struggle between light and darkness, encouraging individuals to cultivate virtues such as courage, compassion, and righteousness.Moreover, Navratri fosters a sense of community and unity among devotees, bringing people together in celebration and worship. Families gather to perform rituals, exchange sweets, and participate in cultural events such as Garba and Dandiya Raas, fostering bonds of love and camaraderie. The festival also holds economic significance, as it provides opportunities for artisans, craftsmen, and businesses to showcase their talents and products. Navratri transcends boundaries of caste, creed, and religion, welcoming people from all walks of life to partake in its joyous festivities and experience the divine presence in their midst.
Article Summary:
Each day of Navratri is associated with a specific colour, symbolizing different aspects of life and spirituality.
Wearing white attire invokes divine blessings and fosters a sense of clarity and positivity.See more: Chaitra Navratri 2024: What do the 9 colours of Navratri signify Red, the colour of passion and power, dominates the fourth day of Navratri.
Each color represents different virtues and qualities, invoking divine blessings and fostering inner transformation.
Lasting for nine days, Navratri is dedicated to the worship of the divine feminine in her various forms, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil.
Through rituals, fasting, and prayers, devotees seek to purify their minds and bodies, inviting divine blessings and guidance into their lives.

Article Title: Amidst pregnancy, Deepika Padukone shares a cryptic post: 'Complaining less ' and 'Praying more'
Article Text:
Mom-to-be Deepika Padukone's mysterious Instagram revelation sparks curiosity among netizens

Check out the post below:

Soon-to-be mommy, Deepika Padukone has shared another cryptic message amidst her pregnancy On Saturday, Deepika took to her Instagram stories to post a quote emphasizing the importance of praying more and complaining less . The message on the note can be read as, 'Complaining less. Praying more. Discussing less. Accomplishing more'.Recently, the ' Padmaavat ' actress shared a post hinting at women's pursuit of success The post resonated with many, particularly as Deepika prepares to balance her personal and professional life amidst her pregnancy, garnering significant attention.She wrote, "'Look around where you are, see what you can do to change the definition of success. So women coming after you won’t feel like they have to choose between success and burnout."Meanwhile, on February 29, 2024, Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone delighted their fans with joyous news. They shared a collaborative picture post featuring baby clothes, milk bottles, and cribs, announcing their pregnancy. Revealing Deepika's expected delivery date as September 2024, the couple left their massive fan base elated.On the work front, Ranveer and Deepika are set to appear together in 'Singham Again'. Ranveer also has projects like 'Don 3' and 'Shaktimaan' lined up, while Deepika is involved in 'Kalki 2989 AD', co-starring Prabhs.
Article Summary:
Mom-to-be Deepika Padukone's mysterious Instagram revelation sparks curiosity among netizensCheck out the post below:Soon-to-be mommy, Deepika Padukone has shared another cryptic message amidst her pregnancy On Saturday, Deepika took to her Instagram stories to post a quote emphasizing the importance of praying more and complaining less .
The message on the note can be read as, 'Complaining less.
"Meanwhile, on February 29, 2024, Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone delighted their fans with joyous news.
They shared a collaborative picture post featuring baby clothes, milk bottles, and cribs, announcing their pregnancy.
Ranveer also has projects like 'Don 3' and 'Shaktimaan' lined up, while Deepika is involved in 'Kalki 2989 AD', co-starring Prabhs.

Article Title: Eid al-Fitr 2024: Latest Mehndi designs: Stunning Mehndi Designs for Eid al-Fitr 2024: From Arabic to Indian Styles
Article Text:
The floral designs

The moon designs

Arabic mehndi designs

Minimalist designs

Indian mehndi designs

Portrait mehndi design

Moroccan mehndi design

Bridal mehndi design

Jewellery mehndi design

Pakistani mehndi designs

The school that beats desert heat by its design! Exploring India with Hyundai Tucson

The sacred month of Ramadan is finally ending with our Muslim brothers and sisters waiting eagerly to enjoy and celebrate the auspicious occasion of Eid Ul-Vida, marking the beginning of the Eid-al-Fitr festival. Coming together and reciting the Holy Quran while sending and receiving well wishes, people purchase new clothes and accessories and meet their friends and family on this auspicious eve.For this holy day, let’s take a look at some stunning mehndi designs for Eid al-Fitr 2024, ranging from Arabic to Indian styles.Floral mehndi patterns can never go out of style as they look visually stunning and appealing with the intricate flower pattern detailing leaves and vines which create a mesmerizing effect. They make the hands look fresh and add a natural charm to them. You can either opt for a full hand art or can simply draw a large flower in the middle with vines on the ends of the palms.Moon designs look the best option for Eid celebrations as it symbolizes the sacredness of Ramadan with the joyfulness of Eid celebrations. You can opt for a beautiful crescent moon design with stars in the centre of the hand and they can be surrounded by the intricate designs and patterns of delicate motifs. Girls willing to have a touch of sophistication with an elegant grace can opt for this mehndi pattern design.Arabic mehndi is one of the most common designs which features bold lines with intricate details creating an enchanting whimsical look. Arabic designs mainly feature floral patterns with geometrical shapes and swirls which adds drama and elegance to the hands and creates a beautiful illusion.If you are someone who embraces simplicity, then the minimalist moon or star motifs with geometric pattern design should be the best option as they create a modern and understated elegance on the hands with a clean and subtle beauty in your hands.Indian mehndi designs are mostly done with lehenga or salwar kameez outfits which include meshworks and paisleys on the hands with a touch of floral patterns having vines and leaves with a round and fuller pattern.Portrait mehndi can be called a self-expression pattern of mehndi design showing one's artistic prowess. People usually create portraits or facial designs of their loved ones with intricate designs and lifelike images around the portrait or main figure.Mainly popular around the Middle East Gulf countries, this type of design is similar to Arabic mehndi designs but is simpler than that. Moroccan mehndi designs look traditional with a unique and trendy base and are believed to ward off any evil with its particular diamond-shaped mehndi design which is created to protect the individual from any evil eye.If you are a newly-wed bride and celebrating your first Eid with your in-laws then opt for the bridal mehndi which has different types of vines and flowers with deep-rooted Indian cultural designs as well which looks stunning and makes your hand attractive with the sharp and intricate detailing.Creating patterns of jewellery on the hand such as a ring-attached bracelet or simple ring illusions around the fingers, the jewellery mehndi design looks simple and subtle, but attractive. You can thus opt for toned down or simpler bangles and ring sets as the mehndi design already creates a stunning illusion.The Pakistani mehndi designs usually include mosques, mandala designs, leaves, flowers, and domes, creating stunning art illusions with a fuller look. It mainly represents the values and traditions of Pakistan, resonating with their culture and heritage with bolder outlining and stunning detailing.
Article Summary:
The floral designsThe moon designsArabic mehndi designsMinimalist designsIndian mehndi designsPortrait mehndi designMoroccan mehndi designBridal mehndi designJewellery mehndi designPakistani mehndi designsThe school that beats desert heat by its design!
You can opt for a beautiful crescent moon design with stars in the centre of the hand and they can be surrounded by the intricate designs and patterns of delicate motifs.

Article Title: 75+ Happy Chaitra Navratri Messages, Greetings, Wishes, Mantras and Quotes for 2024
Article Text:
Wishes and Messages

Quotes on the essence of Navratri: The victory of good over evil

Mantras for Goddes Durga

Apart from these, you can also chant these mantras and shlokas:

Chaitra Navratri is one of the major Hindu festivals which is widely celebrated by devotees across the world. This festival is celebrated in the month of Chaitra, as per the Hindu calendar, and hence named so. Meanwhile, Navratri is made up of two Hindi words-- Nav meaning nine, and Ratri meaning nights. Hence, Navratri is celebrated with great enthusiasm and fervour by devotees for nine nights, worshipping nine forms of Goddess Durga-- one on each day.The nine forms of Goddess or Maa Durga celebrated during these nine auspicious days are-- Maa Shailputri, Maa Brahmacharini, Maa Chandraghanta, Maa Kushmanda, Maa Skandamata, Maa Katyayani, Maa Kalaratri, Maa Mahagauri and Maa Siddhidatri.These nine avatars of Maa Durga or Adi Shakti are called Navadurga.Chaitra Navratri also marks the beginning of the Hindu New Year, and it also signifies the onset of summers. During these nine auspicious days, devotees pray to Maa Durga to seek her protect and blessings, fast, chant mantras and meditate. They get up early in the mornings, take a bath and wear clean clothes, pray to Goddess Durga and only have Satvik food like fruits and certain vegetables. Devotees also refrain from having alcohol, negative thoughts and speech, and Tamsik foods as per Ayurveda.This year Chaitra Navratri is being celebrated from April 9 to April 17, 2024. To help you wish your friends and family on these auspicious days, here we list down some messages, greetings, wishes, mantras and quotes that you can send them. Read on to know more.1. May Maa Durga bless you with her divine powers! Happy Chaitra Navratri!2. Chaitra Navratri is here! Let us fast, pray and meditate together and seek Maa Durga's divine blessings!3. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!4. May you be blessed with the nine forms of Maa Durga on these nine auspicious days! Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!5. Wish you a very happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!6. Navratri is an auspicious time to go inward and reflect upon our deeds to become a better version of ourselves. Happy Chaitra Navratri!12. Navratri is a reminder of good always winning over evil. Happy Chaitra Navratri!13. Let truth prevail. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!14. May this nine auspicious days of Navratri bring love, luck, prosperity and happiness in your life. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!15. May Maa Durga bless us all. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!16. May our lives be filled with sweetness just like the Navratri Bhog and fruits. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!17. May Goddess Durga's divine grace protect us from all harm and lead us towards a path of righteousness. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!18. May this Navratri bring you closer to your spiritual roots and deepen your connection with the divine. Happy Navratri!19. May this Navratri help us grow spiritually. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!20. Wishing you a Navratri filled with devotion, love, and reverence for Goddess Durga. Happy Navratri!21. May the divine presence of Goddess Durga guide you towards righteousness and virtue. Happy Navratri!22. Navratri is a time to remember that no matter what happens in life, good always triumphs over evil. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!23. May Maa Durga protect, bless, and guide us all. Happy Chaitra Navratri 2024!24. May the nine forms of Goddess Durga bless you with wisdom, courage, and compassion. Happy Navratri!25. May we imbibe atleast some good traits from each of the nine forms of Maa Durga this Navratri. Happy Navratri!26.
